results.title: Sirens
results.creator_credit: British Screen Finance Limited, Samson Productions, WMG Film, Sarah Radclyffe Productions-Sirens Limited, Sue Milliken and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Set in a small Australian town in the 1920s, “Sirens” is a light-hearted comedy written and directed by John Duigan (Flirting, The Year my voice broke). It is the (fictional) story of Australian artist Norman Lindsay (Sam Neill) who has raised the ire of the Church, with his erotically charged depictions of nude women. The Church regards his art as sinful, blasphemous and morally damaging. Lindsay is living on a large property in bohemian bliss with his wife (Pamela Rabe), children and models. An English preacher Anthony Campion (Hugh Grant) is sent to Lindsay’s property to try to dissuade him from continuing to paint and draw in his current style. Campion’s wife Estella (Tara Fitzgerald), who accompanies Anthony on this trip, is sexually frustrated and bored with her marriage. The sirens of the title (Elle Macpherson, Portia de Rossi and Kate Fischer) cavort semi-clad for much of their time at the artist’s house and studio, causing the sexual tension between Anthony and Estella, to rise. Estella experiences extensive erotic dreams featuring the sirens and various men she has encountered. “Sirens” features a famed scene where the five main women of the film are shown naked atop a mountain range. An Australian/United Kingdom co-production, also starring Ben Mendelsohn and John Polson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: British Screen Finance Limited, Samson Productions, WMG Film, Sarah Radclyffe Productions-Sirens Limited, Sue Milliken and John Duigan

results.title: Sirene
results.brief_description: Animated satire on present-day commercial life. Depicts a mermaid in the harbour of a modern city who is charmed by a young man playing a flute and attempts to flee with him, but the machines which surround the harbour destroy her. Interesting use of sound (contrast between the harshness of mechanical sounds, and the beauty of flute music), and the animation has a surreal quality that is quite effective.

results.title: Sir! Sir!
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: Here is what happened in a Toronto classroom when teachers occupied the children’s desks and children became the teachers. The film grew out of another, Mrs. Ryan’s Drama Class, where young children found their way into creative drama. There is food for thought in this impromptu reversal of roles.

results.title: Sir William Bragg: physicist experimentalist and teacher
results.brief_description: Sir William Bragg, in conjunction with his son, received the Nobel Prize for his work on X-rays and crystals in 1915. Here at the age of 74, he delivers a lecture about his life and work.

results.title: Sir Oliver Joseph Lodge: mathematical physicist
results.brief_description: An historic film of Sir Oliver Lodge, mathematical physicist and winner of the 1932 Faraday Medal. Sir Oliver, in his 84th year, reviews the electrical age, recalling the early days of discovery including the first dynamo, and incandescent lamp, Alexander Graham Bell demonstrating the telephone, and the work of Hertz.

results.title: Sir Joseph Thomson
results.brief_description: Born in 1856, Joseph Thomson devoted his life to the study of physical science and acheived distinction as an experimentalist and as a teacher. In this film he presents a paper on the importance of scientific discoveries and their application in commerse and industry, resulting in employment and technological advances.

results.title: Sir Johnny-on-the-spot
results.brief_description: A marionette show set on the mythical Isle of Dragonia. Princess Moonglow has to choose a dragon to ride in the grand parade. Star is a beautiful but lazy and conceited dragon and his brother Spot is modest and punctual, but quite ordinary in appearance. She must select the first one she sees at sunrise. Encourages ideas about promptness, reliability and modesty. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Sir John Everett Millais
results.creator_credit: BBC, Kenneth Gordon and Anita Sterner
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Millais’ birth. This program retraces his life and work through letters to and from his contemporaries and through a large collection of paintings and drawings. Provides a complement to “The Pre-Raphaelite revolt”. Narrated by Anne Massey.

results.title: Sir Francis Drake
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Dramatises the preparation and execution of Sir Francis Drake’s raids on the Pacific coast empire of Spain in America. Illuminates the conflicting parties at Elizabeth I’s court - those wishing to conciliate the mighty Philip II, of Spain, and those who sought to attack his vast empire, seize gold and gain glory. Shows how Drake’s extended raid in the Pacific led to the circumnavigation of the world by his ship, the Golden Hind.

results.title: Sir Alec Guinness Ealing comedy: Kind hearts and coronets; The Man in the white suit; The Lavender Hill mob; The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Ealing Studios, Robert Hamer, Charles Crichton and Alexander Mackendrick
results.brief_description: Four features starring Sir Alec Guinness produced by the revered Ealing studio. In “The Ladykillers” Guinness guides a gang of misfits through a daring robbery only to be foiled by their seemingly harmless, elderly landlady. Set in Edwardian England, “Kind hearts and coronets” sees Guinness play eight parts - all victims of a serial killer, determined to claim his birthright. A satire on industry and commerce “The Man in the white suit” features Guinness as a would-be chemist who develops an indestructible fabric. Guinness plays a timid bank clerk who has the perfect scheme for stealing gold bullion from the Bank of England in “The Lavender Hill mob”. These four comedies highlight Guinness’ unerring talent for satire and farce. Also available on VHS “The Lavender Hill Mob” [302796], “Kind Hearts and coronets” [302542], “The Ladykillers” [304307], “The Man in the white suit” [507924].
